channel.title: Hello Humans.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Matt! I’m just a geek that loves to tinker. I’ve been in an out of Linux for just about all of this century. Technically, I started with FreeBSD 3.2 after I got the discs from some old hacker show in the early 2000’s. After that it was Slackware, LFS with a LUG, Gentoo, Arch, and now Fedora. I’ve used quite a few others, but these were my main distros.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Dunno. Hi? Ok. Ok ok ok. Took some googling, but I got this. Installed snapd on Fedora in order to install Hugo extended. This allowed me to use the themes that I really liked. Then I had to clean up my git modules because I kept getting an error about public being in use. After that, I edited the deploy.sh script that I got from the official documentation. It was using https, and I changed it to use ssh.
